summary: Buffs weapon attack speed for all humanoids by 25% and tweaks game mechanics to compensate for the change and to stay true to Requiem's design.
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][font=Times New Roman][center][color=#f1c232][b][font=Georgia]A T T A C K   S P E E D   O V E R H A U L   F O R   R E Q U I E M[/font][/b][/color][/center][/font][/size][font=Georgia][center][i]version 0.9 ("beta"), by Nephtelas, as of Dec 6th 2017
[/i][/center]


[color=#fff2cc][size=4][b][u][i] I N T R O D U C T I O N[/i][/u][/b][/size][/color]


[size=3][b][i]For now, this mod is an adjustment only for Requiem 1.9.4.1! [/i][/b][/size]

[size=3]The Attack Speed Overhaul increases weapon attack speed for all humanoids (ghosts, NPCs, undead) and deals with this change in terms of game balance. Skyrim's default attack rates felt quite sluggish. After the buff, hacking and slashing should feel a bit more natural and less clunky.

But also if this was done for other, less punishing overhauls or vanilla Skyrim, there are still certain interdependencies that have to be considered to not mess up the flow of the game.[/size]

[size=3][i][b]The Attack Speed Overhaul affects the following:[/b][/i]
[/size]
[size=4][b] 1. Attack Speed
2. Weapon Damage
3. Sneak Attack Base Multipliers
4. Weapon Tempering
5. Weapon Enchantments
6. Stamina Use[/b][/size]

[size=3]Apart from the attack speed buff, the other changes of this mod are quite subtle. You shouldn't notice all too much of a difference compared to normal Requiem, because that's actually the whole point of this thing. ;)[/size]



[center][color=#f1c232][size=6][b]! ! !    S E T U P   ! ! ![/b][/size][/color][/center]

[size=3][b]1[/b][/size][b][size=3]. I'd strongly recommend to use the Mod Organizer or the Nexus Mod Manager. Otherwise just unpack and copy the main esp into your Skyrim\Data directory and check it in your launcher.

2. You don't need to update your Reqtificator patch. Put "Attack Speed Overhaul for Requiem.esp" on the block list of it or just don't have it in your load order, when running the tool on occasion.

3. Load it after "Requiem for the Indifferent.esp" (aka your Reqtificator patch).[/size][/b]



[color=#fff2cc][size=3][i][b]COMPATIBILITY:[/b][/i][/size][/color]

[size=3]As this mod is based on it, everything incompatible with Requiem won't work.

Other attack speed related mods such as the Attack Speed Fix and non-Vanilla or non-Requiem spells buffing attack speed are technically okay, but might have to be adjusted to smaller values.

Outside of that, just don't load other stuff, that change the exact same things, namely weapon enchantments, their magic effects, enchanting basic perks and certain game settings. But nothing too wild should happen, stuff just gets overwritten. Nevertheless, if you're stumbling upon an error, make sure to take a good look at the documentation below or feel free to notify me on the nexus page.

[color=#fff2cc][i][b]UN-INSTALLATION:[/b][/i][/color]

As this mod increases weapon speed actor values, these changes will persist even after removing the plugin file. In order to revert back to vanilla attack speeds, I've included a file named "ASO - Requiem - ATTACK SPEED REPAIR.esp" in the mod folder. Activate this after you've removed ASO, start the game and make a save. Then close the game and also remove the repair file.

This applies an attack speed debuff to your character file that should set everything back to normal.


[color=#fff2cc][size=5][b][i][u] D O C U M E N T A T I O N[/u][/i][/b][/size][/color]

- ITMs and other dirty edits manually cleaned with TES5Edit -

[color=#f1c232][size=4][b] [font=Georgia]{1.} WEAPON ATTACK SPEED[/font][/b][/size][/color][u][b]
[/b][/u]
[i]Explanation:[/i] In addition to the buff, I nerfed Flurry, because weapons are fast enough already and for mouse users, hit registration can sometimes be a bit off on very high attack rates (e.g. wielding daggers).

[/size][/font][list]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia]Increased by 25% for all humanoids (ghosts, NPCs, undead, including the player)[/font][/size]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia]Flurry perk increases attack rate by 10%, only when dual-wielding (instead of for all 1H weapons)[/font][/size]
[/list][size=1][font=Georgia]
[size=2]Technical Details: [spoiler]
[font=Georgia]- Entry added to Requiem's mass effect perk (out of convenience): Ability, [/font]increases weapon speed AVs by 0.25, based on new
magic effect triggering [font=Georgia][font=Georgia][font=Georgia]for all actors with keywords "ActorTypeNPC", "ActorTypeGhost" and "ActorTypeUndead"[/font][/font][/font]
- Perk "Flurry30": dual-wielding condition added[/spoiler][/size][/font][/size][font=Georgia][size=3][size=2] [/size]
[color=#ffe599][b][size=4] [color=#f1c232]{2.} WEAPON DAMAGE[/color][/size][/b][/color]
[/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3] 
[i]Explanation:[/i] Obviously, increasing your attack speed means you deal more damage over time, and more importantly, NPCs deal more, too, and naturally demand sharper reaction times already. You don't want them to deal more dps with Requiem. Believe me.

[/size][/font][list]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia]Weapon damage for the player, all NPCs, ghosts and undead globally reduced by 20%[/font][/size]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia]Overall damage over time is the same as before[/font][/size]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]     
[font=Georgia][size=2]Technical Details: [spoiler]
[font=Georgia]- Entry added to Requiem's mass effect perk (out of convenience): Multiply weapon damage by 0.8 for all actors with keywords "ActorTypeNPC", "ActorTypeGhost" and "ActorTypeUndead"[/font][/spoiler][/size][/font]
[color=#f1c232][size=4][b] {3.} SNEAK ATTACK BASE MULTIPLIERS[/b][/size][/color]

[i]Explanation:[/i] As a consequence of reduced weapon damage, your stealthy attacks suffer considerably. They shouldn't.
      
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]All multiplied by 1.25 to make up for the weapon damage nerf[/size][/font]
[/list][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Sneak attack damage totals are the same as before[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=2]Technical Details: [spoiler]
[font=Georgia]- Game settings "fCombatSneak(InsertWeaponTypeHere)Mult" adjusted[/font][/spoiler][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][size=3][b][i]
[/i][font=Georgia][color=#f1c232][size=4] {4.} WEAPON TEMPERING[/size][/color][/font][/b][font=Georgia][i]

Explanation:[/i] These flat numbers also scale superbly with attack speed, which further supports the already quite strong impact smithing can have on the game. Luckily, Requiem uses a hidden perk to adjust tempering values similarly to how I want it. Tempering boni now depend on the different weapon types (instead of just 1H, 2H and bows), so that essentially the total dps increase you get by tempering different weapons is almost identical. Swords however profit a bit more from that, because they gain more attack speed later on by perks.
[/font]
[/size][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]In Requiem, all tempering boni are halved by default, on top of that, the following factors are applied (correlating with attack speed):[/size][/font]
[/list]
[font=Georgia][size=3]                                               0.80 - warhammers, (cross)bows
[/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3]                                               0.68 - battleaxes
                                               0.64 - greatswords
                                               0.60 - maces
                                               0.53 - war axes
                                               0.48 - swords
                                               0.37 - daggers[/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3]

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Note that even the strongest weapon tempering is 20% less effective than before[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]You may still encounter stronger tempered items (I guess? Further testing needed...)[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=2]Technical Details: [spoiler]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][size=2]- Requiem hidden perk "REQ_MechanicsPerk_Crafting_TemperingRescale" entries added and changed...[/size][/size][/font][/size][/font][/spoiler][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[color=#ffe599][b] [color=#f1c232][size=4]{5.} WEAPON ENCHANTMENTS[/size][/color][/b][/color]

[i]Explanation:[/i] On-hit effects are the real deal! Requiem didn't distinguish between weapon types regarding enchantments. Now it does. I've added some little icing on the cake, nerfing 'crowd control' on-hit effects, which I felt should've been implemented in the base game, really. Having this much utility on just one weapon swing felt waaaay too strong for my tastes.
The concept is the same as for tempering. All damage enchantments deal the same damage over time on different weapons of the same tier, when spamming attacks. Again, Swords can profit more later on.

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Banish, Fear and Turn Undead enchantments now apply with a chance of 15% on hit,[/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3] Frost Slow applies with a chance of 30%[/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3], Paralyze applies with a chance 5% (buffed from 2%, I wanna stun people [i]someday...[/i])[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Elves can't enchant items without having the first perk as well (technical convenience)[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Direct nerf to fast weapons[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Enchantment magnitudes in comparison (these are not the real modifiers, just an illustration):[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]
                                                1.000 - Armor, clothing, jewelry, staves, (cross)bows, warhammers
                                                0.857 - Battleaxes
                                                0.800 - Greatswords
                                                0.750 - Maces
                                                0.666 - War Axes
                                                0.600 - Swords
                                                0.462 - Daggers[/size][/font]

[/size][/font][list]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia]Total magnitudes and charge costs adjusted[/font][/size]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia]You can't create stronger enchantments than found on loot with skill level 100 and perks alone, to improve your effectiveness, you'd have to drink some rare enchanter's potion(s)[/font][/size]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia]Unique enchantments adjusted[/font][/size]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia]Most descriptions shortened[/font][/size]
[/list][size=3][font=Georgia]
[size=2][font=Georgia][font=Georgia][font=Georgia]Technical Details: [spoiler]
- Created new magic effects for base enchantments (convenience)
- Created hundreds of enchantments resembling the gradual damage differences of enchanted weapon loot (3 iterations per effect, instead of 6)
[font=Georgia]- Removed the racial conditions in the enchantment entry of (hidden Requiem) perk "AA000XarrianPlayerGeneralPerk01"
[/font][font=Georgia]- Perks "Enchanter00" and "Enchanter20" reworked...[/font]
- CC on hit chances are still constant, regardless of weapon type
- [font=Georgia]Looted vs Self-made enchantment charge costs are each governed by different numbers, but the overall result is exactly the same[/font]
- [font=Georgia]Banish and Turn Undead spells still deal additional flat damage independent of used weapon type[/font][/spoiler][/font][/font][/font][/size][/font][/size][font=Georgia][size=3]
[color=#f1c232][size=4][b] {6.} STAMINA USE[/b][/size][/color]

[i]Explanation:[/i] Swinging faster means tiring quicklier. However, you shouldn't be punished, while still dealing the same DPS as before. Requiem's approach is odd, to say the least. I don't want to badmouth anyone, that's just what I found...

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Stamina use of power attacks now depends on weapon weight again[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]1H is less punishing than 2H again[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]This is how Requiem's stamina drain on regular attacks works now (without wearing any armor):[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
                                                   Weapon           Skill = 0                 W/ Basic Perk       Skill = 100 (+ perk)
                                                   Archery            4     sta/sec            3      sta/sec            1    sta/sec
                                                   1H                     3     sta/swing       2.5   sta/swing       1    sta/swing
                                                   Dual                  4.5 sta/swing       3.75 sta/swing       1.5 sta/swing
                                                   2H                     5     sta/swing       4      sta/swing       1.5 sta/swing

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3](Somehow) your stamina drain slightly depends on your weapon's weight as well[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
[size=3][font=Georgia][size=2][font=Georgia][font=Georgia][font=Georgia]Technical Details: [spoiler]
[font=Georgia]- [/font][font=Georgia]Game setting "fStaminaAttackWeaponBase" set to 10 (formerly 20)[/font]
- [font=Georgia]Game setting "fStaminaAttackWeaponMult" set to 0.4 (formerly 0?)[/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3][size=2]- Requiem hidden perk "REQ_MechanicsPerk_Stress_AttackStamina_Skills" reworked...
- [/size][font=Georgia][size=3][size=2]Removed "19x - Mass-dependent costs for attacks and power attacks" perk entry (caused some strange behavior... maces draining more than 2H axes...)
- [font=Georgia]Added default offsets for bows and one-handed[/font] and basic perk benefits
- [font=Georgia]Changed cut-off values at skill level 100 and adjusted scaling to them[/font][/size][/size][/font][/size][/font][/spoiler][/font][/font][/font][/size][/font][/size][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3]


[color=#fff2cc][b][i]POTENTIAL FUTURE STUFF:[/i][/b][/color]

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Stagger adjustments[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Fine-tuning of utility enchantments[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Bring the concept to Dragonborn[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Make a version without Requiem[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]

author: Nephtelas
